data.title: SC judge questions law secretary’s role in transfer summary
data.description: ISLAMABAD: Justice Shakeel Ahmed, a member of the five-judge Constitutional Bench of the Supreme Court hearing the seniority dispute among judges, on Monday questioned whether the law secretary was competent to clarify in the final summary on transfer that judges would not be required to take a fresh oath upon their posting to the Islamabad High Court. “Were the real facts regarding seniority kept hidden from the chief justices during the process of consultation?” Justice Ahmed asked, expressing concern that such anomalies had led to doubts and raised questions about mala fide intent. The five-judge CB, headed by Justice Muhammad Ali Mazhar, had taken up a joint petition filed by five IHC judges — Justices Mohsin Akhtar Kayani, Tariq Mehmood Jahangiri, Babar Sattar, Sardar Ejaz Ishaq Khan and Saman Rafat Imtiaz. The petition argues that three transferred judges should not be treated as IHC judges until they take a fresh oath under Article 194, read in conjunction with Schedule III of the Constitution. Senior counsel Faisal Siddiqi, representing former presidents of the Islamabad High Court Bar Association, argued that the establishment of the IHC was implemented under Article 175 of the Constitution and that the appointment of its judges under the IHC Act pertained only to the provinces. Even in cases of transfer, he contended, the transfer is not permanent and there is no need for a new oath when a judge returns to his original court. Justice Ahmed asks if chief justices were kept in dark on seniority The counsel also asserted that the powers of the Judicial Commission of Pakistan (JCP) had been undermined in the current system of transfers, contrary to the spirit of the Constitution. Justice Ahmed observed that a unified seniority list of judges across the country could help resolve such disputes. Mr Siddiqi agreed, saying the effects of judicial transfers would become clearer and more transparent with such a list. Attorney General for Pakistan (AGP) Mansoor Usman Awan argued that the Third Schedule of the Constitution does not require a separate oath for IHC judges. He explained that the Constitution only refers to “high courts” for the oath, and the IHC judges had taken the same oath as those transferred from other courts. When Justice Naeem Akhtar Afghan asked whether a new oath was needed under Article 200 in case of transfer, the AGP replied that there was no such requirement under this article. Justice Afghan also inquired why the final summary of the judge transfers made no mention of an oath. The AGP replied that there was an SC verdict on judges’ seniority, and the summary sent to the prime minister was administrative in nature. He explained that under Article 200, the transfer of judges can be either permanent or temporary. In cases of temporary transfer, judges receive additional benefits. In permanent transfers, they are provided with government accommodation. If the transfer is for a limited period, the judge eventually returns to their original high court. The AGP clarified that if a judge is permanently transferred, their seat in the original high court becomes vacant. While government accommodation was provided to judges transferred to the IHC, they did not receive any additional allowances. Moreover, judges who are transferred are not required to take a new oath, he added. Published in Dawn, May 27th, 2025

data.title: Palestine flag flies  at WHO as Israeli strikes continue
data.description: • Over 50 more killed in a single day • Head of  US-backed aid group quits • Only 4.6pc of Gaza land now ‘arable’ • German chancellor says he no longer understands Israeli army’s goal GENEVA: The Palestinian delegation won the right to fly their flag at the World Health Organisation (WHO) after a symbolic victory in a vote on Monday that its envoy hopes will lead to greater recognition within the UN and beyond. The proposal, brought by China, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia and others, at the global agency’s annual assembly in Geneva passed with 95 in favour and four against — Israel, Hungary, Czech Republic and Germany — and 27 abstentions. In apparent reference to the devastating Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, Lebanon’s delegate Rana el-Khoury said the vote’s outcome provided “a small ray of hope for the brave Palestinian people whose suffering has reached unbearable levels”. Israel argued against the WHO resolution and called for a vote. Its main ally, the US, did not participate. Meanwhile, Israel has continued to carry out strikes across Gaza Strip, killing at least 52 people on Monday, 33 of them in a school-turned-shelter. In Gaza City, civil defence agency spokesman Mahmud Bassal said that an early-morning Israeli strike on the Fahmi Al-Jarjawi school, where displaced people were sheltering, killed “at least 33, with dozens injured, mostly children”. Images shared widely on social media showed what appeared to be badly burned bodies being pulled from the rubble. Israel’s military claimed the building was being used as a centre by Hamas and Islamic Jihad to plan and organise attacks. Farah Nussair said the school was sheltering “civilians, children, elderly, women, and men — just the tired ones who needed food and water”. “We fled to the south, they bombed us in the south. We returned to the north, they bombed us in the north. We came to schools …. There is no security or safety, neither at schools, nor hospitals — not anywhere,” she said, a child in her lap. Another strike killed at least 19 people in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip, Bassal said. Aid group’s chief quits The development came as the head of a US-backed foundation set to supply aid in Gaza quit unexpectedly on Sunday, a day before the group was due to begin operations. Jake Wood, executive director of the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation for the past two months, said he resigned because it could not adhere “to the humanitarian principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality, and independence”. The foundation has been boycotted by the UN and the groups supplying aid to Gaza before Israel imposed a total blockade on the enclave in March. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, which would use private contractors working under Israeli security, said it would begin deliveries on Monday, with the aim of reaching one million Palestinians by the end of the week. The Switzerland-registered foundation will screen families for involvement with Hamas, potentially using facial recognition technology, according to aid officials. While the aid system is being worked out, the UN’s Food and Agriculture Organization said on Monday under five per cent of Gaza’s farmland is usable due to war, further exacerbating the risk of famine. By the end of April, more than 80 per cent of the farmland was damaged and 77.8pc was no longer accessible, leaving barely 4.6pc of potentially arable land, according to a new satellite assessment released by FAO. Some 688 hectares (1,700 acres) is all that remains for cultivation, according to the assessment. Israeli official dismisses truce proposal As Israel continues its atrocities, Hamas has agreed to a proposal by US special envoy Steve Witkoff for a Gaza ceasefire, a Palestinian official close to the group told Reuters on Monday. The new proposal, which sees the release of ten hostages and 70 days of truce, was received by Hamas through mediators. “The proposal includes the release of ten living Israeli hostages held by Hamas in two groups in return for a 70-day ceasefire and a partial withdrawal from the Gaza Strip,” the source said. The proposal also sees the release of a number of Palestinian prisoners by Israel, including hundreds of those serving lengthy prison terms. However, an Israeli official dismissed the latest ceasefire proposal from Hamas on Monday, saying no responsible government could accept such an agreement and rejecting the assertion by Hamas that the deal matched one proposed by US special envoy Steve Witkoff. The official, who spoke on condition of anonymity, claimed that Hamas was not interested in a deal. European nations continue to pressure Israel to end the war with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on Monday, saying he now “no longer understands” Israel’s objective in war-ravaged Gaza. “Honestly speaking, I no longer understand what the Israeli army is now doing in the Gaza Strip, with what goal,” Merz told public broadcaster WDR. Published in Dawn, May 27th, 2025
data.translatedTitle: Palestine flag flies  at WHO as Israeli strikes continue
data.translatedDescription: • Over 50 more killed in a single day • Head of  US-backed aid group quits • Only 4.6pc of Gaza land now ‘arable’ • German chancellor says he no longer understands Israeli army’s goal GENEVA: The Palestinian delegation won the right to fly their flag at the World Health Organisation (WHO) after a symbolic victory in a vote on Monday that its envoy hopes will lead to greater recognition within the UN and beyond. The proposal, brought by China, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia and others, at the global agency’s annual assembly in Geneva passed with 95 in favour and four against — Israel, Hungary, Czech Republic and Germany — and 27 abstentions. In apparent reference to the devastating Israel-Hamas war in Gaza, Lebanon’s delegate Rana el-Khoury said the vote’s outcome provided “a small ray of hope for the brave Palestinian people whose suffering has reached unbearable levels”. Israel argued against the WHO resolution and called for a vote. Its main ally, the US, did not participate. Meanwhile, Israel has continued to carry out strikes across Gaza Strip, killing at least 52 people on Monday, 33 of them in a school-turned-shelter. In Gaza City, civil defence agency spokesman Mahmud Bassal said that an early-morning Israeli strike on the Fahmi Al-Jarjawi school, where displaced people were sheltering, killed “at least 33, with dozens injured, mostly children”. Images shared widely on social media showed what appeared to be badly burned bodies being pulled from the rubble. Israel’s military claimed the building was being used as a centre by Hamas and Islamic Jihad to plan and organise attacks. Farah Nussair said the school was sheltering “civilians, children, elderly, women, and men — just the tired ones who needed food and water”. “We fled to the south, they bombed us in the south. We returned to the north, they bombed us in the north. We came to schools …. There is no security or safety, neither at schools, nor hospitals — not anywhere,” she said, a child in her lap. Another strike killed at least 19 people in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip, Bassal said. Aid group’s chief quits The development came as the head of a US-backed foundation set to supply aid in Gaza quit unexpectedly on Sunday, a day before the group was due to begin operations. Jake Wood, executive director of the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation for the past two months, said he resigned because it could not adhere “to the humanitarian principles of humanity, neutrality, impartiality, and independence”. The foundation has been boycotted by the UN and the groups supplying aid to Gaza before Israel imposed a total blockade on the enclave in March. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, which would use private contractors working under Israeli security, said it would begin deliveries on Monday, with the aim of reaching one million Palestinians by the end of the week. The Switzerland-registered foundation will screen families for involvement with Hamas, potentially using facial recognition technology, according to aid officials. While the aid system is being worked out, the UN’s Food and Agriculture Organization said on Monday under five per cent of Gaza’s farmland is usable due to war, further exacerbating the risk of famine. By the end of April, more than 80 per cent of the farmland was damaged and 77.8pc was no longer accessible, leaving barely 4.6pc of potentially arable land, according to a new satellite assessment released by FAO. Some 688 hectares (1,700 acres) is all that remains for cultivation, according to the assessment. Israeli official dismisses truce proposal As Israel continues its atrocities, Hamas has agreed to a proposal by US special envoy Steve Witkoff for a Gaza ceasefire, a Palestinian official close to the group told Reuters on Monday. The new proposal, which sees the release of ten hostages and 70 days of truce, was received by Hamas through mediators. “The proposal includes the release of ten living Israeli hostages held by Hamas in two groups in return for a 70-day ceasefire and a partial withdrawal from the Gaza Strip,” the source said. The proposal also sees the release of a number of Palestinian prisoners by Israel, including hundreds of those serving lengthy prison terms. However, an Israeli official dismissed the latest ceasefire proposal from Hamas on Monday, saying no responsible government could accept such an agreement and rejecting the assertion by Hamas that the deal matched one proposed by US special envoy Steve Witkoff. The official, who spoke on condition of anonymity, claimed that Hamas was not interested in a deal. European nations continue to pressure Israel to end the war with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz on Monday, saying he now “no longer understands” Israel’s objective in war-ravaged Gaza. “Honestly speaking, I no longer understand what the Israeli army is now doing in the Gaza Strip, with what goal,” Merz told public broadcaster WDR. Published in Dawn, May 27th, 2025

data.title: ADB to help govt with climate policy
data.description: ISLAMABAD: The Asian Development Bank has agreed to assist Pakistan develop a strategy and climate policy framework aimed at enhancing environmental resilience and climate adaptability in the country. The decision was taken in a meeting of ADB Director General Bruno Carrasco-led delegation with Federal Minister for Climate Change and Environmental Coordi­nation Dr Musadik Malik and other officials. Pakistan’s climate resilience and environmental sustainability agenda was discussed. During the meeting, both parties emphasised the importance of a comprehensive and forward-looking approach to tackle the pressing challenges of climate change. The discussion focused on youth-led climate initiatives by providing necessary support in terms of preparation, mentorship and funding. Both sides recognised the potential of such initiatives to not only contribute meaningfully to climate solutions but also position themselves competitively on the global innovation landscape. The meeting also explored avenues for joint ventures in climate financing and investments, with the goal of mobilizing substantial resources towards sustainable development. Mr Malik highlighted the need to transition from planning to implementation, assuring ADB of his full cooperation and commitment throughout all stages to ensure that agreed outcomes are achieved effectively. The potential for partnerships in carbon credit markets was also deliberated upon, with both sides agreeing to explore viable mechanisms for monetizing environmental performance and emissions reductions. Published in Dawn, May 27th, 2025

data.translatedTitle: Sweden wants to stop allergenic substances - six years later they are still allowed
data.translatedDescription: The Swedish Chemicals Agency wants to limit around 1,000 substances that are estimated to be able to cause life -long allergies. After six years, the proposal is still with the EU. - If we find something, we can do nothing more than inform the companies, says Camilla Westlund, inspector at the Swedish Chemicals Agency.

data.title: Erik de la Reguera: Hjälteinsats av Liverpools räddningstjänst mitt i tragedin
data.description: Det som skulle ha varit ett enda stort firande för Liverpool slutade för många fans i chock och panik. Men mitt i tragedin visade räddnings- och ambulanspersonalen också stadens vackraste sida: att man finns där för varandra när det verkligen gäller.
data.translatedTitle: Erik de la Reguera: Hero effort by Liverpool's rescue service in the middle of the tragedy
data.translatedDescription: What would have been a single big celebration for Liverpool ended too many fans in shock and panic. But in the middle of the tragedy, the rescue and ambulance staff also showed the most beautiful side of the city: that you are there for each other when it really matters.

data.title: Cancerframkallande ämne hittat i barnkläder i Sverige
data.description: Mängder av kemikalier gömmer sig i kläder köpta i Sverige – även i plagg gjorda för nyfödda. Några undersökta plagg innehåller halter av ett cancerframkallande ämne, över den tillåtna gränsen. – Vi blev själva chockerade i början när vi såg hur mycket kemikalier som fanns, säger Ulrika Nilsson, professor i kemi vid Stockholms universitet.
data.translatedTitle: Carcinogenic subject found in children's clothing in Sweden
data.translatedDescription: Lots of chemicals hide in clothing purchased in Sweden - even in garments made for newborns. Some examined garments contain levels of a carcinogen, above the permitted limit. - We were shocked ourselves in the beginning when we saw how much chemicals existed, says Ulrika Nilsson, professor of chemistry at Stockholm University.

Z kolei kraje mające najmniejszy udział w powodowaniu zmian klimatycznych ponoszą największe ryzyko ich konsekwencji, w tym rosnącego zagrożenia przemocą i konfliktami – wynika z nowych badań.

data.translatedTitle: Governor of Boi drives rise from yen
data.translatedDescription: Banco do Japan governor (Boj), Kazuo Ueda, gave yen a boost on Tuesday by clearly nominating his intention to continue to increase the reference interest rate if the economy improves as expected.

data.title: Carolina Correia promete trabalho na estreia
data.description: A futebolista Carolina Correia, estreante em convocatórias para a seleção portuguesa feminina, disse que trabalhará para ser opção nas duas últimas jornadas do Grupo A3 da Liga das Nações e poder “continuar a ser chamada”.
data.translatedTitle: Carolina Correia promises work at the debut
data.translatedDescription: The footballer Carolina Correia, a newcomer to call for the Portuguese female team, said she will work to be an option in the last two journeys in Group A3 of the League of Nations and being able to “continue to be called”.

data.title: Vinte e duas jogadoras para o Euro sub-19
data.description: A selecionadora nacional Marisa Gomes convocou 22 futebolistas para estágio com vista ao Europeu feminino sub-19, a decorrer na Polónia em junho, lista que ficará reduzida a 20 para o torneio.
data.translatedTitle: Twenty-two players for the U-19 Euro
data.translatedDescription: National team coach Marisa Gomes summoned 22 internship footballers overlooking the U-19 Women's European, taking place in June in June, a list that will be reduced to 20 for the tournament.

data.title: 4h Sindicato PSP denuncia problemas no controlo nos aeroportos
data.translatedTitle: 4h PSP Union denounces problems in control at airports

data.title: Iúri Leitão brilha na Gala da Confederação do Desporto de Portugal
data.description: O ciclista Iúri Leitão foi triplamente distinguido na 28.ª Gala da Confederação do Desporto de Portugal (CDP), sendo eleito Atleta Masculino de 2024 e conquistando o prémio "Equipa" com o também campeão olímpico Rui Oliveira.
data.translatedTitle: Iúri Leitão shines in the gala of the Portuguese Sports Confederation
data.translatedDescription: Cyclist Iúri Leitão was triple distinguished at the 28th gala of the Portuguese Sports Confederation (CDP), being elected male athlete of 2024 and winning the "team" prize with also the Olympic champion Rui Oliveira.

data.title: Portugal fora da final no Euro de ginástica artística
data.description: Portugal não se apurou para a final da prova feminina de all-around do Campeonato da Europa de ginástica artística, com as ginastas lusas a terminarem todas abaixo dos primeiros 50 lugares.
data.translatedTitle: Portugal out of the final at the euro of artistic gymnastics
data.translatedDescription: Portugal did not find out for the end of the All-Around women's race of the European Gymnastics European Championship, with the Portuguese gymnasts finishing all below the first 50 places.

data.title: Atropelamento de Liverpool faz 27 feridos
data.description: O atropelamento múltiplo de segunda-feira na cidade de Liverpool, durante os festejos da conquista do campeonato de futebol britânico pelo clube desta cidade do norte de Inglaterra, obrigou à hospitalização de 27 feridos, anunciaram no mais recente balanço as autoridades locais.
data.translatedTitle: Liverpool run over makes 27 injuries
data.translatedDescription: The multiple running on Monday in the city of Liverpool, during the celebrations of winning the British Football Championship for the club of this northern city of England, forced the hospitalization of 27 injured, announced the latest local authorities.

data.title: António Costa tenta aprofundar a cooperação entre a UE e o Brasil
data.description: O presidente do Conselho Europeu, António Costa, inicia em Brasília uma visita oficial ao Brasil, que decorre até quinta-feira, para aprofundar a cooperação entre o país e a União Europeia (UE), nomeadamente ao nível político e comercial.
data.translatedTitle: António Costa tries to deepen cooperation between EU and Brazil
data.translatedDescription: The president of the European Council, António Costa, begins in Brasilia an official visit to Brazil, which runs until Thursday, to deepen cooperation between the country and the European Union (EU), namely at the political and commercial level.

data.title: Utilizadores da Meta podem proteger os seus dados
data.description: Os utilizadores europeus das plataformas da Meta que desejem opor-se à utilização dos seus dados para treinar os modelos de inteligência artificial (IA) generativa têm até esta terça-feira para o fazer.
data.translatedTitle: Goal users can protect your data
data.translatedDescription: European users from the goal platforms wish to oppose the use of their data to train Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) models have until Tuesday to do so.

data.title: 3h Ministra aguarda conclusões da IGAS sobre caso dermatologista
data.translatedTitle: 3h minister awaits IGAS conclusions about dermatologist case

data.title: Votos dos emigrantes começam a ser contados
data.description: Os votos dos emigrantes portugueses, que decidirão o segundo partido mais votado nas legislativas de 18 de maio em Portugal, começam esta terça-feira a ser contados em Lisboa, estando marcado o apuramento final para quarta-feira.
data.translatedTitle: Emigrant votes begin to be counted
data.translatedDescription: The votes of Portuguese emigrants, who will decide the second most voted party in the May 18 legislatures in Portugal, start this Tuesday to be counted in Lisbon, being marked the final determination for Wednesday.

data.title: Câmara do Porto está a tentar comprar parte de baixo da casa de Almeida Garrett
data.description: O presidente da Câmara do Porto, Rui Moreira, disse que a autarquia está a tentar comprar a parte de baixo da casa onde nasceu o escritor Almeida Garrett, com vista a ali instalar um polo do Museu do Liberalismo.
data.translatedTitle: House of Porto is trying to buy part of Almeida Garrett's house
data.translatedDescription: The mayor of Porto, Rui Moreira, said the municipality is trying to buy the bottom of the house where writer Almeida Garrett was born, with a view to installing a pole of the liberalism museum.

data.title: 2h Avião da TAP entre Porto e Nova Iorque aterra no Canadá
data.translatedTitle: 2h TAP plane between Porto and Nova Yorque land in Canada

data.translatedTitle: 1h ASPP/PSP denounces unmatched situation at airports

data.translatedTitle: 0h discarded hypothesis of terrorism in the run over in Liverpool

data.title: Trump insulta antecessor e juízes no Dia da Memória
data.description: O Presidente norte-americano, Donald Trump, lançou insultos ao seu antecessor e aos juízes no Dia da Memória nos Estados Unidos, cuja cerimónia aproveitou para se elogiar a si próprio juntamente com os militares mortos em serviço.
data.translatedTitle: Trump insults predecessor and judges on memory day
data.translatedDescription: US President Donald Trump launched insults to his predecessor and judges on memory day in the United States, whose ceremony took the opportunity to praise himself along with the military personnel killed in service.

data.title: Supremo vai investigar filho de Bolsonaro por `lobby` nos EUA contra autoridades brasileiras
data.description: O Supremo Tribunal Federal (STF) do Brasil anunciou segunda-feira a abertura de inquérito para investigar alegados atos do deputado suspenso Eduardo Bolsonaro a favor da aplicação de sanções contra juízes e autoridades brasileiras por parte dos Estados Unidos.
data.translatedTitle: Supreme will investigate Bolsonaro's son for `lobby 'in the US against Brazilian authorities
data.translatedDescription: The Federal Supreme Court (STF) of Brazil announced Monday the opening of an inquiry to investigate alleged acts of suspended deputy Eduardo Bolsonaro in favor of the application of sanctions against judges and Brazilian authorities by the United States.

data.title: Libertados ativistas detidos na Guiné-Bissau
data.description: Os ativistas detidos pela polícia, no domingo, em Bissau, foram libertados na noite desta segunda-feira, informou hoje a Frente Popular.
data.translatedTitle: Released activists detained in Guinea-Bissau
data.translatedDescription: The activists arrested by the police on Sunday in Bissau were released on Monday night, today said the Popular Front.

data.title: Violência doméstica. "Atitude patriarcal" predomina nos tribunais
data.description: É preciso mais apoio para as vítimas de violência doméstica, sexual e cibernética, em especial no que diz respeito às mulheres.
data.translatedTitle: Domestic violence. "Patriarchal attitude" predominates in courts
data.translatedDescription: It takes more support for victims of domestic, sexual and cyber violence, especially with regard to women.

data.title: Presidente da República quer indigitar primeiro-ministro "logo que possa"
data.description: O presidente da República pode indigitar o próximo primeiro-ministro já na quinta-feira. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa diz que está a trabalhar para garantir a estabilidade política para além do final do próprio mandato.
data.translatedTitle: President of the Republic wants to indignate Prime Minister "as soon as he can"
data.translatedDescription: The President of the Republic may appoint the next prime minister on Thursday. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa says he is working to ensure political stability beyond the end of his own mandate.

data.title: Governo cabo-verdiano quer apurar "desobediência" de pilotos a requisição civil
data.description: O Governo cabo-verdiano pretende apurar responsabilidades de pilotos que terão desobedecido a uma requisição civil, durante uma greve de cinco dias, que terminou na segunda-feira, na Transportes Aéreos de Cabo Verde (TACV), anunciou em comunicado.
data.translatedTitle: Cape Verdean government wants to investigate "disobedience" of pilots to civil request
data.translatedDescription: The Cape Verdean government intends to investigate riders' responsibilities who will have disobeyed a civil request during a five-day strike that ended on Monday at Cape Verde Air transport (TACV), announced in a statement.

data.title: AM Porto aprova nova concessão do Edifício Transparente preocupada com indefinição
data.description: A Assembleia Municipal do Porto aprovou esta noite, por unanimidade, o prolongamento por um ano da concessão do Edifício Transparente, cuja demolição está prevista até 2028, mas várias forças políticas manifestaram preocupação quanto à indefinição em torno da infraestrutura.
data.translatedTitle: AM Porto approves a new concession of the transparent building concerned with undefined
data.translatedDescription: The Municipal Assembly of Porto unanimously approved the extension for one year of the concession of the transparent building, whose demolition is foreseen until 2028, but several political forces expressed concern about the indefinition surrounding the infrastructure.

data.title: Lucros da Mota-Engil crescem 37% para 27 ME no 1.º trimestre
data.description: Os lucros atribuíveis ao grupo Mota-Engil atingiram, no primeiro trimestre, 27 milhões de euros, um aumento homólogo de 37%, adiantou a empresa, em comunicado à Comissão do Mercado de Valores Mobiliários (CMVM).
data.translatedTitle: Mota-Engil profits grow 37% to 27 ME in the 1st quarter
data.translatedDescription: The profits attributable to the Mota-Engil group reached, in the first quarter, 27 million euros, a 37%homologous increase, the company said in a statement to the Securities Market Commission (CMVM).

data.title: Benjamin Nethanyahu promete recuperar todos os reféns do Hamas
data.description: Israel avisa que não vai parar a ofensiva contra Gaza. O primeiro-ministro israelita promete resgatar todos os reféns que continuam nas mãos do Hamas.
data.translatedTitle: Benjamin Netanyahu promises to recover all the hosts of Hamas
data.translatedDescription: Israel warns that it will not stop the offensive against Gaza. The Israeli Prime Minister promises to rescue all the hostages that continue in the hands of Hamas.

data.title: Atropelamento em Liverpool. Polícia não suspeita de ataque terrorista
data.description: Quase meia centena de pessoas ficaram feridas na sequência de um atropelamento em Liverpool. Aconteceu durante os festejos da conquista do campeonato inglês.
data.translatedTitle: Running over in Liverpool. Police not suspected of terrorist attack
data.translatedDescription: Almost half a hundred people were injured following a running in Liverpool. It happened during the festivities of winning the English Championship.

data.title: Avião da TAP obrigado a aterrar de emergência no Canadá devido a odores a bordo
data.description: Um avião da TAP foi obrigado a aterrar de emergência, na noite desta segunda-feira, no aeroporto de Gander, no Canadá.
data.translatedTitle: TAP plane forced to land emergency in Canada due to odors on board
data.translatedDescription: A TAP plane was forced to land an emergency on Monday night at Gander airport in Canada.

data.title: Λέκκας για τον σεισμό στον Κορινθιακό: «Ξέφυγε από την καθιερωμένη σεισμικότητα»
data.description: O καθηγητής Γεωλογίας και Διαχείρισης Φυσικών Καταστροφών, Ευθύμης Λέκκας, επεσήμανε ότι οι ειδικοί παρακολουθούν «πολύ στενά την εξέλιξη του φαινομένου».
data.translatedTitle: Lekkas on the earthquake in Corinth: "He escaped from established seismicity"
data.translatedDescription: Professor of Geology and Natural Disaster Management, Efthimi Lekkas, pointed out that experts are "closely following the evolution of the phenomenon".

data.description: Γάζα και ελληνοτουρκικά στο συντονιστικό πολιτικό κέντρο του ΠαΣοΚ που πραγματοποιήθηκε σε καλό κλίμα. Η συνεδρίαση της Σοσιαλιστικής Διεθνούς στην Κωνσταντινούπολη και η επίσκεψη Ανδρουλάκη στο Προκόπι της Εύβοιας.
data.translatedTitle: PASOK: Androulakis earthquakes - Gaza initiatives
data.translatedDescription: Gaza and Greek -Turkish at the PASOK Coordinating Political Center held in a good climate. The meeting of the Socialist International in Constantinople and the visit of Androulakis to Prokopi, Evia.

data.description: Ληστεία σημειώθηκε το πρωί της Δευτέρας σε βενζινάδικο στον Ασπρόπυργο. Δείτε βίντεο ντοκουμέντο.

data.translatedDescription: A robbery took place on Monday morning at a gas station in Aspropyrgos. Watch a documentary video.

data.title: Κριστιάνο Ρονάλντο: Φεύγει από την Αλ Νασρ, ψάχνει άλλη ομάδα στα 40 του
data.description: Την απόφασή του να ολοκληρώσει την παρουσία του στην Αλ Νασρ ανακοίνωσε ο Κριστιάνο Ρονάλντο, ο οποίος βρίσκεται σε αναζήτηση της επόμενης ομάδας του.

data.translatedDescription: Cristiano Ronaldo, who is in search of his next team, announced his decision to complete his presence in Al Nasser.

data.title: Το Βήμα Σήμερα Podcast: Τι νόημα έχουν οι νέοι αυστηροί νόμοι όταν δεν εφαρμόζονται;
data.description: Ο Αντώνης Ντινιακός, δημοσιογράφος στο «ΒΗΜΑ», εξηγεί γιατί το πειθαρχημένο νομοθετικό πλαίσιο της χώρας αποτυγχάνει να εφαρμοστεί στην πράξη. Τι προσφέρει στην κυβέρνηση η διαρκής αυστηροποίηση των νόμων.
data.translatedTitle: The step today podcast: What is the meaning of new strict laws when they do not apply?
data.translatedDescription: Antonis Dinakos, a journalist at VIMA, explains why the country's disciplined legislative framework fails to apply in practice. What the government offers the continued tightening of laws.

data.description: Στο υπόμνημά της η Βόρεια Κορέα, χώρα που διαθέτει πυρηνικό οπλοστάσιο, κατηγόρησε τις ΗΠΑ πως είναι «αποφασισμένες να στρατιωτικοποιήσουν το διάστημα».

data.translatedDescription: The ECB president noted that the US president's comments on the EU are part of the "challenge" he likes to use and "we are used to, unfortunately"

data.title: 5 το πρωί: Το «όχι» του Ισραήλ – Τα μέτρα για τον στρεπτόκοκκο – Το σχέδιο για τον ΟΠΕΚΕΠΕ
data.description: Μια ακόμη συμφωνία εκεχειρίας ανάμεσα στη Χαμάς και το Ισραήλ δεν έγινε αποδεκτή από το Τελ Αβίβ. Την ίδια στιγμή, 500.000 άνθρωποι κινδυνεύουν από λιμό στη Λωρίδα της Γάζας, ενώ οι Ευρωπαίοι εξετάζουν το ενδεχόμενο να επιβάλουν εμπάργκο όπλων στο Ισραήλ. Πώς μπορεί να τερματιστεί τελικά αυτός ο πόλεμος;

data.title: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.description:
RIYADH: Rent increases and fuel price rises helped Saudi Arabia post an inflation rate of 2.3 percent in April — the same level as a year earlier — official data showed.

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.
data.translatedTitle: Saudi Arabia’s annual inflation rate holds steady at 2.3% in April: GASTAT
data.translatedDescription:

	According to the latest figures from the General Authority for Statistics, a 6.8 percent increase in the cost of housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels contributed to the rise.

	Within this category, rents paid for housing rose by 8.1 percent, driven by an 11.9 percent spike in apartment rental prices, a category that holds significant weight in the overall index.

data.title: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season
data.description:
MANCHESTER: Erling Haaland said Manchester City must deliver in the FA Cup final on Saturday to salvage something from a “horrific” season that saw them deposed as English champions for the first time in five years.
	City face Crystal Palace at Wembley aiming to avoid a first trophyless campaign since Pep Guardiola’s debut season in charge in 2016/17.
	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.
data.translatedTitle: Haaland eyes FA Cup to save face after Man City’s ‘horrific’ season

	Guardiola’s men sit fourth in the Premier League, 18 points adrift of champions Liverpool, and in a battle just to secure a top-five finish and Champions League football next season in their final two league matches.

data.title: Ben Sulayem drives major improvements to FIA’s international Sporting Code
data.description: DUBAI: The Federation Internationale de l’Automobile, the global governing body for motor sport and the federation for mobility organizations worldwide, has announced that it is to make major improvements to Appendix B of its International Sporting Code following an extensive review commissioned by FIA’s President Mohammed Ben Sulayem.

data.title: Russian delegation arrives in Turkiye for Ukraine war talks
data.description:
ISTANBUL: Russia’s delegation arrived in Istanbul for peace talks with Ukraine, Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova said Thursday, and a Ukrainian official said a delegation including President Volodymyr Zelensky was on its way the the Turkish capital Ankara.
	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.

	Russian President Vladimir Putin was not part of the delegation from Moscow, however, according to a list released by the Kremlin Wednesday night, prompting criticism from Western officials that the Kremlin isn’t serious about the peace effort.

data.title: Lufthansa group suspends Tel Aviv flights following Houthi attacks on Israel
data.description:
BERLIN: Airline group Lufthansa will suspend its flights to Tel Aviv through May 25, it said on Thursday, citing the “current situation.”
	This affects flights operated by Lufthansa, Swiss, Austrian Airlines, Eurowings, ITA Airways, Brussels Airlines and Lufthansa Cargo, it added.
	Global airlines have again halted their flights to and from Tel Aviv after a missile fired by Yemen’s Houthis toward Israel on May 4 landed near the country’s main international airport in Tel Aviv.

data.title: Al-Ain to host 6th IMMAF Youth World Championships in July
data.description:
ABU DHABI: The UAE Jiu-Jitsu and Mixed Martial Arts Federation has announced that the sixth IMMAF Youth World Championships will be held in Al-Ain Region for the first time from July 21-27.

	The tournament will be staged at the Al-Ain Convention Center with more than 1,000 male and female athletes from 60 countries competing in the championship’s largest event to date.

data.title: India says Pakistan nuclear arsenal should be under UN surveillance
data.description:
SRINAGAR: Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal should be brought under the surveillance of the UN’s nuclear agency, Indian Defense Minister Rajnath Singh said Thursday, following last week’s conflict between Islamabad and New Delhi.

	“I wanted to raise this question for the world: are nuclear weapons safe in the hands of a rogue and irresponsible nation?” Singh told troops at a base in Srinagar in Indian-administered Kashmir.
data.translatedTitle: India says Pakistan nuclear arsenal should be under UN surveillance

data.title: Madinah municipality continues intensive food safety inspections
data.description:
MADINAH: Food safety inspections have been stepped up ahead of the arrival of Hajj pilgrims, reported the Saudi Press Agency on Thursday.

	The Madinah Regional Municipality has carried out routine testing of commercial establishments, with 4,165 samples to date confirmed as conforming to approved standards. So far, 186 samples have been deemed unfit for human consumption.

data.title: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs
data.description:
RIYADH: US President Donald Trump said on Thursday in Doha that India had offered the US a trade deal with zero tariffs.

	New Delhi is seeking to clinch a trade deal with the US within the 90-day pause on tariff hikes announced by Trump on April 9 for major trading partners, which had included a 26 percent tariff on India.

	“It is very hard to sell in India, and they are offering us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariffs,” Trump said in a meeting with executives in Doha.
data.translatedTitle: Trump: India has offered US a trade deal with zero tariffs

data.title: Jordan evacuates second group of cancer patients from Gaza
data.description:
AMMAN: Jordan’s government on Wednesday began evacuating four child cancer patients and 12 family members from Gaza.

	They are the second group of patients evacuated for treatment under the Jordan Medical Corridor initiative, started in March this year, that aims to treat 2,000 Gazan children.

	The children and their families were evacuated by the Royal Jordanian Air Force in cooperation with the World Health Organization and the Ministry of Health.

	They will be treated at the King Hussein Cancer Center.

data.title: Centralización vs. Descentralización: Un debate para la economía cubana
data.description: El debate entre las decisiones de la planificación centralizada o la planificación a nivel de empresa o a nivel de consumidor es un tema ya viejo en los debates sobre el socialismo. Los primeros debates sobre estos temas ocurrieron en los años 20 del siglo pasado en la Unión Soviética, cuando se empezó a discutir, en primer lugar, la existencia o no, de relaciones monetarias- mercantiles en el socialismo. Eso estaba de telón de fondo, en este tema. Y se llegó a una conclusión que la vida probó posteriormente que era errada y era que partía de que las relaciones monetarias – mercantiles existían en el socialismo por las diferentes formas de propiedad y dejaban vacío el hueco, donde no se explicaba cómo esas relaciones tenían una existencia propia en la propiedad estatal, en la propiedad social. The post Centralización vs. Descentralización: Un debate para la economía cubana first appeared on Cubadebate .
data.translatedTitle: Centralization vs. Decentralization: A debate for the Cuban economy
data.translatedDescription: The debate between centralized planning decisions or planning at the company level or at the consumer level is an old issue in debates about socialism. The first debates on these issues occurred in the 20s of the last century in the Soviet Union, when the existence or not, of monetary-commercial relations in socialism began to be discussed first. That was in the backdrop, on this subject. And a conclusion was reached that life subsequently proved that it was wrong and it was that it was that monetary - commercial relations existed in socialism for the different forms of property and left the hole empty, where it was not explained how these relationships had their own existence in state property, in social property. The post centralization vs. Decentralization: A debate for the Cuban economy First Appeared on Cubadebate.

data.title: “El nombre de Katy quedará limpio; es una calumnia”: amistades defienden a joven acusada en SPS
data.description: San Pedro Sula, Honduras.- La reciente captura de Katherine Yulibeht Romero Sorto , acusada por la Fiscalía de supuestos delitos sexuales contra dos menores de edad, ha generado una ola de reacciones entre personas que la conocen, quienes aseguran que se trata de una grave falsa acusación y defienden su inocencia. Amigos cercanos, conocidos y familiares de la joven han manifestado en redes sociales su respaldo a Romero Sorto, señalando que la acusan injustamente y que su comportamiento no concuerda con las graves imputaciones que se le atribuyen. “Ella es una muy buena hermana e hija decente, y es más que obvio que esto es un gran error y una acusación falsa”, afirmó una usuaria de Facebook, identificada como Brenda Rodríguez, quien expresó su indignación ante la situación. Por su lado, otra usuaria identificada como Waldina Colindres, fue aún más enfática: “Esta es una vil calumnia hacia la "chinita". Pero todo saldrá a la luz, y que caiga todo el peso de la ley sobre esa persona que quiere dañar a la chinita”. Otros hondureños han coincidido en destacar la personalidad y la actitud positiva de la imputada, especialmente su relación con los niños. “Los que conocemos a Kathy sabemos de su amor y paciencia para todos, en especial a los niños. Confiamos en Dios que todo se aclare y que las personas que se encargan de difamar paguen”, expresó una usuaria en redes sociales. Asimismo, en redes sociales sus allegados aseguran que se trataría de una acusación falsa derivada de su relación de pareja. Romero Sorto fue detenida recientemente por la Agencia Técnica de Investigación Criminal (ATIC) y remitida a la Penitenciaría Nacional de Adaptación Social (PNFAS), mientras se desarrolla el proceso judicial. La audiencia inicial ha sido programada para el próximo 28 de mayo. Las autoridades continúan las investigaciones, mientras el Ministerio Público sostiene que existen elementos suficientes para sustentar los cargos. No obstante, la joven cuenta con el respaldo de quienes la consideran víctima de una acusación infundada, lo que refuerza el llamado a respetar el principio de presunción de inocencia y a esperar el desarrollo del proceso en los tribunales.
data.translatedTitle: "Katy's name will be clean; it is a slander": Friendships defend young man accused in SPS
data.translatedDescription: San Pedro Sula, Honduras.- The recent capture of Katherine Yulibeht Romero Sorto, accused by the prosecution of alleged sexual crimes against two minors, has generated a wave of reactions between people who know it, who assure that it is a serious false accusation and defend their innocence. Nearby, acquaintances and relatives of the young woman have manifested on social networks her support for Romero Sorto, pointing out that they unjustly accuse her and that her behavior does not agree with the serious imputations attributed to her. "She is a very good sister and decent daughter, and it is more than obvious that this is a big mistake and a false accusation," said a Facebook user, identified as Brenda Rodríguez, who expressed her outrage at the situation. On the other hand, another user identified as Waldina Colindres, was even more emphatic: "This is a vile slander towards the" Chinita ". But everything will come to light, and that the entire weight of the law on that person who wants to damage the chinita” falls. Other Hondurans have agreed to highlight the personality and positive attitude of the accused, especially their relationship with children. "Those of us who know Kathy know about their love and patience for all, especially children. We trust God that everything is clarified and that people who are responsible for defame pay," said a user on social networks. Also, in social networks their relatives say that it would be a false accusation derived from their relationship. Romero Sorto was recently arrested by the Technical Agency for Criminal Investigation (ATIC) and sent to the National Penitentiary of Social Adaptation (PNFAS), while the judicial process develops. The initial hearing has been scheduled for May 28. The authorities continue investigations, while the Public Ministry argues that there are sufficient elements to support the positions. However, the young woman has the support of those who consider her a victim of an unfounded accusation, which reinforces the call to respect the principle of presumption of innocence and to wait for the development of the process in the courts.

data.title: ‘Mel’ Zelaya es el único narco con quien me he reunido, asegura Romeo Vásquez
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- Luego que se hicieran públicos cuatro fragmentos de videos donde supuestamente Romeo Vásquez se reúne con narcos, el general en condición de retiro se pronunció en redes sociales. El exjefe de las Fuerzas Armadas aseguró que nunca se ha reunido con narcotraficantes e ironizó cuando sostenía encuentros con el expresidente Manuel Zelaya Rosales . Vásquez hizo varias publicaciones en su perfil de Facebook, una de ellos con una foto al lado de Manuel Zelaya con el mensaje "este es el único narco con quien me he reunido en mi vida. Atentamente, general Romeo Vásquez". La publicación se acompañó de: "En mi carrera política me he reunido con muchas personas honorables, pero jamás con narcotraficantes. Me atacan porque no me arrodillo ante este gobierno corrupto y aliado al crimen. ¡El pueblo me conoce! Y sabe que siempre he defendido a Honduras con honor, no con dólares sucios. ¡Yo no soy Carlos Zelaya!". En otro post acotó: "Lo repito una vez más, ni con todo el dinero del Estado, ni con la nueva tecnología ni con la inteligencia artificial me van a poder incriminar en el narcotráfico". Cuatro de los ocho supuestos narcovideos de Romeo Vásquez Velásquez , que tiene la Fiscalía en su poder, fueron compartidos este lunes 26 de mayo. En el primer clip, que dura menos de 10 segundos, se puede ver al general en condición de retiro Romeo Vásquez Velásquez sentado en una sala de una casa con un narco hondureño. En otra parte se escucha a Vásquez hablar del expresidente Juan Orlando Hernández y recibir una bolsa, supuestamente con dinero.
data.translatedTitle: ‘Mel’ Zelaya is the only narco with whom I have gathered, says Romeo Vásquez
data.translatedDescription: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.- After four videos of videos were made public where Romeo Vásquez is supposed to meet with drug traffickers, the general withdrawal was pronounced on social networks. The former Chief of the Armed Forces said he has never met with drug traffickers and ironized when he held meetings with former president Manuel Zelaya Rosales. Vásquez made several publications on his Facebook profile, one of them with a photo next to Manuel Zelaya with the message "This is the only narco with whom I have gathered in my life. Sincerely, General Romeo Vásquez." The publication was accompanied by: "In my political career I have met with many honorable people, but never with drug traffickers. They attack me because I don't kneel before this corrupt government and allied to crime. The people know me! And they know that I have always defended Honduras with honor, not with dirty dollars. I am not Carlos Zelaya!". In another post he said: "I repeat it once again, or with all the money of the State, neither with the new technology nor with artificial intelligence they will be able to incriminate me in drug trafficking." Four of the eight narcovideos supposed narcovideos of Romeo Vásquez Velásquez, who has the Prosecutor's Office in his possession, were shared on Monday, May 26. In the first clip, which lasts less than 10 seconds, you can see the general with retirement condition Romeo Vásquez Velásquez sitting in a house with a Honduran narco. Otherwise Vásquez is heard of former president Juan Orlando Hernández and receiving a bag, supposedly with money.

data.title: CNE fija presupuesto de L1,737 millones para elecciones generales 2025
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- El Consejo Nacional Electoral (CNE) definió este lunes el presupuesto para las elecciones generales de noviembre próximo en Honduras, proyecto que asciende a los 1,737,500,000 lempiras. Luego que el pleno de consejeros del CNE definiera la cantidad, en las próximas horas el proyecto será remitido a la secretaría del Congreso Nacional (CN) para su discusión y posterior aprobación. A su llegada a la cámara legislativa el proyecto del CNE entrará vía correspondencia, para luego ser turnado a la Comisión de Presupuesto, quien dictaminará la iniciativa. “El CNE avanza con firmeza y transparencia hacia las Elecciones Generales 2025, en este momento se define el presupuesto especial de L. 1,737,500,000.00 que será enviado al Congreso Nacional, reafirmando nuestro compromiso con un proceso íntegro y democrático”, informó a través de cuenta de X, la consejera presidenta Cossette López . Inicialmente el Congreso aprobó el presupuesto de L1,492 millones, meses después el CNE pidió una ampliación de L561,045,280.00. Por lo que con las reformulaciones que se hicieron para la contratación de sistemas tecnológicos entre otros, las primarias tuvieron un costo total de L2,053,045,280. No obstante, a diferencia del proceso electoral pasado, en este proyecto el CNE remitirá un presupuesto más bajo al anterior, reflejando una diferencia de L315,545,280.00 al gestionado para los comicios del 9 de marzo. Este próximo jueves 29 de mayo, el pleno del CNE dará el banderillazo a los partidos políticos para la celebración de las elecciones generales.
data.translatedTitle: CNE fixed budget of L1,737 million for general elections 2025
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- The National Electoral Council (CNE) on Monday defined the budget for next November elections in Honduras, a project that amounts to 1,737,500,000 lempiras. After the Plenary of CNE counselors defined the amount, in the next few hours the project will be sent to the Secretariat of the National Congress (CN) for its discussion and subsequent approval. Upon arrival at the Legislative Chamber, the CNE project will enter via correspondence, and then be turned to the Budget Commission, who will rule the initiative. "The CNE advances with firmness and transparency to the general elections 2025, at this time the special budget of L. 1,737,500,000.00 is defined that will be sent to the National Congress, reaffirming our commitment to an entire and democratic process," said the Cossette López President. Initially, Congress approved the Budget of L1,492 million, months later the CNE requested an extension of L561,045,280.00. So with the reformulations that were made for the hiring of technological systems among others, the primary cost had a total cost of L2,053,045,280. However, unlike the last electoral process, in this project the CNE will send a lower budget to the previous one, reflecting a difference of L315,545,280.00 to the managed for the elections of March 9. This next Thursday, May 29, the Plenary of the CNE will give the banderilla to the political parties for the celebration of the general elections.

data.title: Demandan al Estado de Honduras por US$300 millones por caso Palmerola
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras .- El Grupo EMCO presentó este lunes una demanda internacional por más de 300 millones de dólares contra el Estado de Honduras, al que acusa de sabotear la operación del Aeropuerto Internacional de Palmerola e intentar expropiar la concesión de forma indirecta. En un comunicado, la empresa detalló que la acción legal fue interpuesta para “proteger su inversión” y hacer valer los derechos del contrato de concesión, supuestamente vulnerado por medidas adoptadas por el actual gobierno, las cuales califica de arbitrarias, ilegales y discriminatorias. La demanda menciona que el Estado habría violado disposiciones de dos tratados internacionales: el DR-CAFTA y el Tratado de Libre Comercio entre Centroamérica, al adoptar acciones que obstaculizan las operaciones de Palmerola International Airport S.A. de C.V., filial del Grupo EMCO. El conglomerado también denunció que el gobierno ha ejercido presiones sobre otras de sus empresas, como Alutech, a la cual se le impidió importar materia prima en 2024, lo que paralizó su producción. “Desde el inicio de esta administración, la intención ha sido expropiar Palmerola. Han saboteado la operación para forzar nuestra salida o exigir pagos indebidos”, afirmó el grupo, representado en el proceso arbitral por el bufete internacional Greenberg Traurig, LLP. La empresa recordó que en enero de 2024 desistió de una acción ante el CIADI tras firmar un memorando de entendimiento con el gobierno, pero acusa a autoridades, como la actual titular de la Secretaría de Defensa, de emitir declaraciones públicas de carácter político que incumplen el acuerdo. EMCO sostiene que Honduras enfrenta una creciente ola de demandas internacionales por presuntas violaciones al debido proceso, incumplimientos contractuales y una política oficial que desincentiva la inversión. “Reiteramos nuestro compromiso con Honduras y nuestro objetivo de seguir generando desarrollo”, concluyó el comunicado.
data.translatedTitle: They demand the state of Honduras for US $ 300 million by Palmerola case
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras .- The EMCO Group filed an international demand for more than 300 million dollars against the state of Honduras, which accuses of sabotaging the operation of Palmerola International Airport and trying to expropriate the concession indirectly. In a statement, the company explained that the legal action was filed to “protect its investment” and enforce the rights of the concession contract, allegedly violated by measures adopted by the current government, which qualifies as arbitrary, illegal and discriminatory. The lawsuit mentions that the State would have violated provisions of two international treaties: DR-CAFTA and the Free Trade Agreement between Central America, by adopting actions that hinder the operations of Palmerola International Airport S.A. of C.V., subsidiary of the Emco Group. The conglomerate also denounced that the government has exercised pressures on other companies, such as Alutech, which was prevented from importing raw material in 2024, which paralyzed its production. "Since the beginning of this administration, the intention has been to expropriate Palmerola. They have sabotaged the operation to force our departure or demand undue payments," said the group, represented in the arbitration process by the international firm Greenberg Traurig, LLP. The company recalled that in January 2024 he gave up an action before CIADI after signing a memorandum of understanding with the government, but accuses authorities, as the current head of the Secretariat of Defense, of issuing public statements of a political nature that breached the agreement. Emco argues that Honduras faces a growing wave of international demands for alleged violations of due process, contractual breaches and an official policy that discourages investment. "We reiterate our commitment to Honduras and our goal of continuing to generate development," the statement concluded.

data.title: Carrera de Periodismo de la UNAH reconoce a 10 profesionales que dignifican su labor
data.description: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- En el marco de su 55° aniversario , la carrera de Periodismo de la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Honduras (UNAH) reconoció hoy a diez egresados destacados cuya labor ha fortalecido la democracia, la libertad de expresión y el pensamiento crítico en el país, según coincidieron autoridades universitarias. Durante el acto, celebrado en el auditorio Jesús Aguilar Paz, se entregaron diplomas de reconocimiento a periodistas como María Antonia Martínez, Amada Esperanza Ponce, Eduardo Maldonado y Carlos Mauricio Flores, director ejecutivo de EL HERALDO. A su vez, destacaron la trayectoria periodística de Jessica Regina Mass, Emy Lily Padilla, Ana Elsy Mendoza, Renato de Jesús Álvarez, Juan Carlos Barahona y Jhony José Lagos. “Este país necesita voces que no teman, que no se vendan y que no se callen”, expresó el rector de la máxima casa de estudios, Odir Fernández, quien hizo un llamado a defender con valentía la libertad de expresión. Por su parte, Denia Cruz, jefa del Departamento de Periodismo, afirmó que “hoy la carrera no solo honra su pasado, sino que se proyecta con firmeza hacia el futuro”. En ese sentido, se anunciaron nuevos proyectos académicos como una maestría en Comunicación multimedia y un doctorado en Comunicación, en alianza con la Universidad Nacional de La Plata, Argentina. .
data.translatedTitle: Journalism career of UNAH recognizes 10 professionals who dignify their work
data.translatedDescription: Tegucigalpa, Honduras.- Within the framework of its 55th anniversary, the journalism career of the National Autonomous University of Honduras (UNAH) today recognized ten outstanding graduates whose work has strengthened democracy, freedom of expression and critical thinking in the country, university authorities coincided. During the act, held at the Jesús Aguilar Paz Auditorium, diplomas of recognition were given to journalists such as María Antonia Martínez, Amada Esperanza Ponce, Eduardo Maldonado and Carlos Mauricio Flores, executive director of El Heraldo. In turn, they highlighted the journalistic career of Jessica Regina Mass, Emy Lily Padilla, Ana Elsy Mendoza, Renato de Jesús Álvarez, Juan Carlos Barahona and Jhony José Lagos. "This country needs voices that do not fear, that are not sold and not to shut up," said the rector of the highest house of studies, Odir Fernández, who called to defend freedom of expression with courage. For his part, Denia Cruz, head of the Department of Journalism, said that "today the race not only honors its past, but is firmly projected towards the future." In that sense, new academic projects were announced as a master's degree in multimedia communication and a doctorate in communication, in alliance with the National University of La Plata, Argentina. .

data.title: Депутат Госдумы предложил предоставлять льготы натурализованным мигрантам после 20 лет проживания в РФ
data.description: Депутат Госдумы РФ, руководитель фракции «Справедливая Россия – За правду» Сергей Миронов предложил предоставлять социальные выплаты, льготы и жилищные сертификаты мигрантам с российским гражданством, прожившим на территории страны не менее 20 лет. Соответствующий законопроект он направил в правительство России на рассмотрение,  сообщает ТАСС .
data.translatedTitle: State Duma deputy proposed to provide benefits to naturalized migrants after 20 years of residence in the Russian Federation
data.translatedDescription: The State Duma deputy, the head of the Fair Russia - For Pravda faction, Sergei Mironov proposed to provide social payments, benefits and housing certificates to migrants with Russian citizenship, who have lived in the country for at least 20 years. He submitted the corresponding bill to the Russian government for consideration, reports TASS.

data.title: DSP o Maquiavélico Ganancioso
data.description: Guineenses, mais uma vez, venho para vos alertar sobre o perigo que Domingos Simões Pereira representa para a Guiné-Bissau. Faço esse alerta a todos os guineenses sem exceção que se encontre no país ou no estrangeiro, ao PAIGC em especial e na pessoa do Cipriano Cassamá em concreto. Alerta esse sobre o verdadeiro DSP, o verdadeiro espírito que move esse sujeito, o qual alguns ainda continuam a acreditar para não dizer adorar. Domingos Simões Pereira é um manipulador, um verdadeiro chantagista e calculista provavelmente, tipo de comportamento que ultrapassa o nível de psicopata. U m ambicioso desmedido, um verdadeiro criminoso que sabe como e quando cometer o crime. Ele jamais coabitaria não só com JOMAV, assim como com qualquer presidente que seria eleito, a não ser o que ele apoiou disfarçadamente. Isto porque ele tem sua própria agenda, e o PAIGC é simplesmente uma plataforma para sua concretização. DSP jamais coabitaria com JOMAV porque o seu candidato preferido era o Paulo Gomes e sempre será, o qual juntamente com Tchitchi vão delineando mecanismo de modo a serem os novos donos da Guiné-Bissau. Segundo eles este é um processo a médio prazo, e é preciso coragem e paciência para concretiza-lo. Ganhar o congresso não importa em que circunstância e ter novamente o partido na mão, é uma fase concluída em proveito deles, enquanto verdadeiros militantes do PAIGC estão a bater palmas. Depois dessa eleição legislativa, não importa o resultado, o Cipriano Cassama que se prepare a mala ou fica de bico fechado, pois o candidato preferido para o partido será o Paulo Gomes, e esse sim deve ter a voz dentro do partido. DSP é um ambicioso desmedido, nunca teve consideração por ninguém, JOMAV muito menos, o sujeito é um maquiavélico nato, Cipriano Casama será descartado quando menos esperar podes tomar a nota. Guineenses, falar do Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi é falar do MCCI e demais outras organizações e personalidades camufladas no nosso país. Esses dois indivíduos são os principais financiadores do MCCI e demais outras personalidades boca de aluguel na cidade de Bissau. O MCCI, Milícia idealizado por JBV e DSP, agora financiado e dirigido por "futuro triângulo do poder" ou seja, "DSP, Paulo Gomes e Tchitchi", têm 3 principais objectivos: 1º Perturbar a ordem pública em nome da cidadania, difamar e tentar descredibilizar qualquer que seja organizações ou indivíduos não alinhados ao triângulo, de modo a suportar suas caminhadas na busca do poder. 2º Caso se concretize o objectivo do triângulo, o papel da Milícia do MCCI passará a ser de vigilância constante a todos os adversários de modo a garantir falsa paz social e o poder de controlo. 3º Tentar ganhar credibilidade junto das organizações internacionais e regionais, através de suas visitas e actividades de fachada, para quando houver as tais actividades de perturbações de ordem pública, poderem ganhar notoriedade. Mas isso não deve preocupar ninguém, pois estão bem identificados e bem caçados, dentro e fora da Guiné-Bissau. Não tenho nada contra ninguém, mas quem continuar a perturbar verdadeira paz social dos guineenses em troca de benefícios como sempre foi nos últimos anos dessa crise, e que sempre tenho tolerado, então que fique claro "estou firme e determinado para tudo e todos". Para finalizar, gostaria de vos deixar uma reflexão com a seguinte frase: " Domingos Simões Pereira é um perigo grave para o futuro do país ". Isto porque publicar aqui tudo que é necessário para provar ou sustentar a razão dessa frase, só pode agravar ainda mais a paz social que tanto necessitamos. Chega, chega não podemos continuar a viver nessa turbulência vida toda, meus irmãos guineenses, não é saudável, é tóxico, não é justo para um povo que tanto sofreu. António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13

I make this alert to all Guineans without exception that you are in the country or abroad, to the PAIGC in particular and the person of Cyprian Cassamá in concrete. Warns this about the true DSP, the true spirit that moves this subject, which some still continue to believe not to say to worship. Domingos Simões Pereira is a manipulator, a real blackmailer and calculator, probably, kind of behavior that goes beyond the psychopath level. An ambitious excessive, a true criminal who knows how and when to commit the crime. He would never cohabble not only with Jomav, as well as with any president who would be elected, except what he supported undercover. This is because it has its own agenda, and PAIGC is simply a platform for its realization. DSP would never cohabble with Jomav because his favorite candidate was Paulo Gomes and always will be, who together with Tchitchi are outlining mechanism so that they are the new owners of Guinea-Bissau. According to them this is a process in the medium term, and it takes courage and patience to realize it. Winning Congress does not matter under what circumstances and have the party again in hand, it is a phase completed for them, while true PAIGC militants are clapping. After this legislative election, no matter the result, Cipriano Cassama who prepares the suitcase or is closed, because the favorite candidate for the party will be Paulo Gomes, and this must have his voice inside the party. DSP is an ambitious excessive, never considered by anyone, much less Jomav, the subject is a born Machiavellian, Cyprian Casama will be discarded when least expecting you can take the note. Guineans, talking about Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi is talking about MCCI and other other camouflaged organizations and personalities in our country. These two individuals are MCCI's main funders and other other rental mouths in the city of Bissau. The MCCI, a militia designed by JBV and DSP, now funded and directed by "future triangle of power" ie "DSP, Paulo Gomes and Tchitchi", have 3 main objectives: 1st disrupting public order in the name of citizenship, defaming and trying to disbelief whatever organizations or individuals not aligned with the triangle in order to support their walks in the search for power. 2º If the objective of the triangle is realized, the role of the MCCI militia will become constant surveillance to all opponents to ensure false social peace and the power of control. 3º Try to gain credibility with international and regional organizations, through their visits and facade activities, so when there are such public order disturbance activities, they can gain notoriety. But this should not worry anyone, as they are well identified and well hunted, inside and outside Guinea-Bissau. I have nothing against anyone, but those who continue to disturb true social peace of the Guineans in exchange for benefits as always has been in the last years of this crisis, and that I have always tolerated, so that it is clear "I am firm and determined for everything and everyone." Finally, I would like to leave you a reflection with the following sentence: "Domingos Simões Pereira is a serious danger to the country's future." This is because publishing here everything that is necessary to prove or support the reason for this sentence, can only further aggravate the social peace we need so much. Enough, enough we can not continue to live in this turbulence all life, my Guinean brothers, is not healthy, it is toxic, not fair to a people who suffered so much. data.title: DSP, UM PERIGO GRAVE PARA FUTURO DO PAÍS
data.description: Os meios de comunicação também são as formas de manipulação mais utilizadas pelos poderes políticos, dado o seu impacto social. As informações são manipuladas não apenas tendo em vista omitir factos relevantes, mas também distorcer o conteúdo da informação veiculada, produzir ou forjar a opinião pública, de modo que a mesma se ajuste às ideias dos gananciosos. A única forma dos cidadãos evitarem cair nestes processos de manipulação é tornarem-se mais vigilantes em relação às instituições democráticas e aos órgãos de informação, adoptando uma atitude de permanente reflexão crítica sobre a informação que lhes é fornecida. Na Guiné-Bissau, nos últimos anos, cresceu exponencialmente o número de pessoas mediocres, pessoas sem escrúpulos ligadas à produção de rádios e outros meios de comunicação com influencia na nossa sociedade, gente que apesar da sua enorme influência na sociedade, trabalha na mais completa impunidade e sem qualquer controlo ético/democrático. Obcecado pelo poder, ciente da dificuldade do povo guineense em avaliar informações, ciente do poder dos instrumentos de comunicação, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) nunca menosprezou esses instrumentos para atingir seu objectivo, sempre usou-os de forma desonesta como agora está a fazer tudo por tudo para manter no controlo desses veicúlos, mesmo que isso custe a vida dos outros. Governou na corrupção, no nepotismo e no desvios de somas astronómicas do dinheiro de povo, que muito serviria para investimentos na saúde, educação e outros serviços publicos, para beneficiar familiares e amigos. Finge que preocupa com os problemas do país, mas só engana o povo honesto, humilde e trabalhador que infelizmente sofre muito, não sei até quando, devido a sua paciência e tolerância aos governantes como DSP, criminoso travestido em politico que vive na custa de povo e acima de tudo ainda fa-lo refem do próprio suor. Roubou e decepcionou tanto não só aos guineenses assim como a comunidade internacional que sempre acreditou que o sujeito era ideal para ajudar esse povo a sair do ciclo de sofrimento que parece infinito. Foi demitido, não conformou e está a fazer tudo na medida do possível para continuar a complicar a vida dos guineenses. Razão disso é que depois de perder a batalha nos meios de comunicações mais modernos nomeadamente os blogues onde investiu grandes somas do dinheiro de povo, para fazer a lavagem cerebral dos menos instruídos e não só. Fugiu do facebook onde sempre frequentava e comunicava com todos tentado passar a mensagem de um politico moderno e aberto a diálogo/opiniões, mas que afinal era simplesmente um falso modernista. Caiu a mascara e já não consegue enganar ninguem, pois a sua credibilidade está abaixo de zero, para não dizer outra coisa. Camaradas, para conhecimento geral, com o dinheiro roubado que custou suor de povo guineense, DSP decidiu avançar com um outro novo plano maquiavelico, para criar a sua própria estação de rádio. Documento António Aly Silva » aaly.silva@gmail.com » aaly_silva@hotmail.com » Tel. (+245) 668 31 13
data.translatedTitle: DSP, a serious danger to the country's future
data.translatedDescription: The media are also the most used forms of manipulation by political powers, given their social impact. The information is manipulated not only in view of omitting relevant facts, but also distorting the content of the information conveyed, producing or forging public opinion, so that it adjusts to the ideas of the greedy. The only way for citizens to avoid falling into these manipulation processes is to become more vigilant in relation to democratic institutions and information bodies, adopting an attitude of permanent critical reflection on the information provided to them. In Guinea-Bissau, in recent years, the number of mediocre people has grown exponentially, unscrupulous people linked to the production of radios and other media with influence on our society, people who despite their enormous influence on society, work on more complete impunity and without any ethical/democratic control. Obsessed with power, aware of the difficulty of the Guinean people in evaluating information, aware of the power of communication instruments, Domingos Simões Pereira (DSP) has never belittled these instruments to achieve their goal, always used them dishonestly how it is now doing everything to keep in control of these vehicles, even if it costs the lives of others. He ruled in corruption, nepotism and deviations from astronomical sums of people's money, which would serve much for investments in health, education and other public services, to benefit family and friends. It pretends to worry about the problems of the country, but only deceives the honest, humble and worker people who are unfortunately suffering a lot, I don't know how long, due to their patience and tolerance to rulers like DSP, a politician-crossed criminal who lives at the expense of people and above all they still do so. He stole and disappointed so much not only to the Guineans as well as the international community that always believed that the subject was ideal to help these people get out of the suffering cycle that seems infinite. He was fired, did not conform and is doing everything as far as possible to continue to complicate the life of the Guineans. Reason for this is that after losing the battle in the most modern media, namely the blogs where it invested great sums of people's money, to make the brainwash of the less educated and beyond. He ran away from Facebook where he always attended and communicated with everyone attempted to give the message of a modern politician and open to dialogue/opinions, but after all he was simply a false modernist. The mask fell and can no longer fool anyone, because its credibility is below zero, not to say something else. Comrades, for general knowledge, with the stolen money that cost Guinean people sweat, DSP decided to advance with another new Machiavellian plan, to create his own radio station. data.translatedDescription: "No one can attribute the power to decide for all the colored legislators, and much less do it in an unable and unilateral way," said Conrado Rodríguez and Adrián Juri, after the conference provided by Senator Andrés Ojeda and the deputy Felipe Schipani. After a month of work, the Special Commission of the Chamber of Deputies approved on Monday in general the bill related to the Retirement and Pensions of University Professionals (CJPPU).
